The claim was made by Sen: Erin Lynch, a Warwick Democrat, during the debate in the Senate on June 11.
The claim was supported by a study from: a liberal think tank, which looked at workers earning less than $11.10 per hour.
The claim was further supported by a thr: page infographic from the Rhode Island AFL-CIO and a report from the Center for Economic Policy and Research, both of which found the average age of minimum wage workers to be 35.
